feed.title: Google Cloud: Application Design Center
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Application Design Center

entry.content: You can import Terraform modules to create components (Preview). For more information, see Import components.
entry.summary: You can now import Terraform modules to create components. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Import Terraform modules

entry.content: You can set up Application Design Center using a single project boundary. For more information, see Set up Application Design Center.
entry.summary: Application Design Center can now be set up within a single project boundary.
entry.title: Feature: Application Design Center Setup

entry.content:
Application Design Center supports the following components:

  • Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Node Pool
  • GKE Standard Cluster
  • GKE Autopilot Cluster
  • Firestore
entry.summary: Check out the latest features of Application Design Center!
entry.title: Feature: Application Design Center

entry.content: You can export Terraform to your code repository. For more information, see Export Terraform code.
entry.summary: Export your Terraform code to your repository.
entry.title: Feature: Terraform Export

entry.content:
Application Design Center is generally available (GA), including the following:

  • Application Design Center Google Cloud CLI.
  • Design Center API.
entry.summary: Application Design Center is now generally available. This includes the Application Design Center Google Cloud CLI and the Design Center API.
entry.title: Announcement: Application Design Center is Generally Available
